title: Koios - Elastic Cardano Query Layer
description: With the increase in blockchain size, the costs of maintaining query layers are expensive, leading to inconsistent centralized solutions.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a great proposal to produce an optimized query layer and API for blockchain queries. The proposal is quite reasonable for what would be a valuable resource and allow development on Cardano at reduced cost and complexity.
f6_assessments.q1: Detailed proposal by an experienced group of SPO dev's. Every expectation they will be able to deliver.
f6_assessments.q2: Detailed proposal with milestones and deliverables that will be simple to audit. KPI's on usage could be added, though given the breadth of the group building this and claps for the proposal its clear it already has wide support.

f6_assessments.q0: The elastic search will be scalable and more reliable than the individual search. It will be a mandatory requirement in the future when the Cardano blockchain is expected to increase in size. The proposal is complete with an all-encompassing deliverable and with a commitment to operate the core infrastructure till there is an adaptation of the technology. This has the potential to become the standard for writing queries in Cardano once it is available.
f6_assessments.q1: Guild Operators (consortium) of developers is maintaining toolsets and training documents for running of stake pools. The resources are one of the best in the space. It has enabled the proliferation of  Cardno-node deployment on a test basis. The tools are state of art and are updated on daily basis. .With this background, it is very likely that the team implement the proposal successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal includes Koios APIs (https://cardano-community.github.io/guild-operators/Build/grestspecs/) and has a clear considered implementation plan. The budget is very reasonable. The complete code is going to be open source to enable the community in participating in hosting the infrastructure. The success is also easily measurable in a quantified manner.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposer teams identified a clear problem that they want to solve: it take many resources and require a lot of experience to operate a base layer infrastructure. With further growth of Cardano these efforts will increase and therefore will be not manageable without having a certain amount of devs and financial capacity. The proposed solution includes an open-source API, that is decentralized and will make it easier to build on Cardano. Therefore, this proposal fits perfectly into this challenge and with its implementation we can expect a positive impact on our ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: The team behind that proposal is very active in the Cardano community and has already delivered some valuable solutions/tools. The Github profile from the project as well of each team member shows many activity and from my perspective they are definitely capable of delivering this proposal. The presented plan includes a broad variety of features of the API. To further improve this proposal I would like to see more technical details. But overall it is clear, what we can expect from the solution. The budget is broken down in details and absolutely fair priced I am convinced, that they will successfully implement this project.
f6_assessments.q2:
They team offers different opportunities to track their ongoing activities. There is a Github repository linked and also a website already with some documentations. I like the fact, that they have reflected their doings and also compared it to existing approaches and were able to position themselves among those initiatives.
The roadmap and timeline are presented in detail. To improve this proposal, they could add some numbers like how many users they expect to use their API after a certain amount of time. That would help to assess the success of this proposal even more. In conclusion, I state, that this team provides us with sufficient information for auditing this proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: This projects aims to provide an open source solution to easily setup the infrastructure needed for most dapps. The team also shows clear values and style of architecture that align with the nature of the challenge
f6_assessments.q1: The team has already provided essential solutions for SPO's used by many. Their work is publicly available and they have been more then willing to assist others. The plan itself seems achievable given the budget and timeline
f6_assessments.q2: There is a clear set of deliverables and several ways for others to keep track of the process of the project. This includes bi weekly sessions as well as the github codebase providing a broad view. Some goals could have been included in terms of expected usage over different timescales.

solution: An open-source, decentralized API featuring elastic infrastructure and built-in complex query solutions making building on Cardano easier.
experience: A well-known talent pool in the Cardano ecosystem who have demonstrated a deep understanding of the blockchain across guild-ops projects.
